alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:31PM CDT until August 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MARION COUNTY... At 131 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hamilton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Hackleburg, Lake Buttahatchee, Brinn, Bear Creek, Tessner, Pearces Mill, Piney Grove and Upper Bear Creek Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
